Description: Rim sherd of North Ionian pottery plate or shallow dish; creamy white slip. Broad ledge rim with light ridge at join with wall on inside. Interior: stopt maeander band on top of rim; exergue line of broken maeander on floor, with rays in exergue; exterior reserved; dots on outside of rim.
Curator's comments: According to pottery analysis by P. Dupont (personal communication, 30-31 May 1978) at the Centre de recherches archéologiques, laboratoire de céramologie, the clay from sherd belonging to the same vase (Cambridge NA51) originated in North Ionia, while more specifically Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80) argue that the geochemical characteristics of that sherd point to an origin in the region of Teos.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.442)
